newsitem.title: USA: CME lumber rises $10 limit on key Sept contract.
newsitem.headline: CME lumber rises $10 limit on key Sept contract.

text.p: CME lumber futures were locked up the $10 per thousand board feet limit on the key September contract around midsession, boosted by commercial buying and light fund short covering, dealers said.
A Canadian holiday kept volume thin and limited selling interest.
"At least half the natural sellers are on holiday," one dealer said.

They noted R.B. and H. Financial Services were a featured buyer of September in what may have been commercial activity while Cargill Investor Services were a light buyer with their interest possibly fund related.
Cash trade was slow. Last week's Slocan Forest Products Ltd announcement it would close mills one week of downtime remained a background supportive influence.
At 1140 CDT September lumber futures were up the $10.00 per thousand board feet limit, bid at $356.90 per tbf. Other months were $8.50 to $3.80 higher.
